definitions.definition: a small computer that is easy to carry, with a large touch screen and usually without a physical keyboard

examples.text: The company has launched its latest 10-inch tablet.
Consumers show a growing preference for tablets and smartphones over PCs and laptops.

definitions.definition: a small round solid piece of medicine that you swallow

examples.text: Take two tablets with water before meals.
I took the tablets prescribed by my doctor.
The drug is now available in tablet and capsule form.

definitions.definition: an amount of a substance in a small, round, solid piece
a flat piece of stone that has words written on it, especially one that has been fixed to a wall in memory of an important person or event

examples.text: The school has a memorial tablet engraved with the name of the founder.
We can be very flexible—our entry requirements are not set in **tablets of stone** *(= they can be changed)*.

definitions.definition: a number of pieces of paper for writing or drawing on, that are fastened together at one edge

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French tablete, from a diminutive of Latin tabula ‘plank, tablet, list’.
